1. Research: Do your homework beforehand to find out the current market rate for the role and its associated benefits. This will give you a starting point to negotiate.

2. Be flexible yet clear: When negotiating, be willing to compromise on aspects that are less important to you, but ensure you are clear on the essential benefits and salary expectations.

3. Know your value: Highlight your skills and experience during the discussion of salary and benefits. Explain how your past accomplishments can contribute to the company and add value.

4. Be prepared to walk away: If you feel like the offer is not in line with your expectations or worth, it is okay to walk away. Stay polite, courteous and respectful in doing so.

5. Follow up in writing: After agreeing on a salary and benefits package, it is crucial to ensure that both parties have a clear understanding. Follow up with an email or letter referencing and summarizing the agreed-upon details.
